\n\nRed triangle is the pattern currently playing. Grey is queued for change at the next measure.
\n\nThe green bar indicates what step the sequencer is on no matter what pattern is playing.
You access project options by clicking this button in the top row.
Choose either OpenSL or AAudio as the driver. Try what works best with your hardware.
The idea of CONTROLLER is to do things to patterns and ex. effects in a live setting. The big buttons lets you take off your socks and push them with your toes if you want to.

Change the order of progression by clicking a box and selecting a new. The slider enables/disables boxes.

If PROGRESSION is turned off the same pattern will always play unless changed manually. If it\'s turned on it will either progress in the order above or change to a random pattern, depending on RANDOMIZE. EDIT opens
\n\nIf QUEUE is on manual pattern changes will occur at the start of the next measure. If off it\'s instant.
\n\nRESET PROGRESSION resets progression when the sequencer is stopped.

These represents tracks. 

In the first spinner you select a sound preset. In the second spinner with a number in it you select the number of sub steps. 

Every step has one or more sliders in it depending on the number of sub steps. If it's full it will always be on. Half means 50% etc. 

Tick the FX-box for randomized effects on the track. The RND-box adds a 10% chance of ON autorandomizing with RTRN on every step. 

Remove the track by clicking "-". Hold and drag to change order.
Access autorandomization by clicking this tab.

When AUTORANDOMIZATION is selected the sequencer turns from showing its base value to showing its AUTORANDOMIZATION values. These are: 

 %: chance a randomization will occur. A full bar means a randomization will always occur. A half bar means a 50% chance of randomization.

 MIN: smallest possible randomized value. Not present for booleans.

 MAX: largest possible randomized value. Not present for booleans.

 RTRN: if on the value returns to what it was before the randomization after being played once.

 You select which one to edit to the top left of the sequencer.
If an autorandomization is active this purple dot will show in the upper left corner when in BASE mode.

Every track and the master bus can have an unlimited amount of effects and all their parameters can be fully automated.

List of the effects in the order they effect the signal with the top one being first. Hold and drag an effect to change order. Click an effect to edit it. \n\n\"-\" removes the effect.
\n\n\"+\" adds a new random effect to the chain.
Every effect can have an unlimited number of automations on all their parameters, or several automations on the same parameter etc. \n\n\"+\" adds a new randomized automation.

Select what parameter to automate in the spinner and the value in the slider. The value will be applied in the selected steps, in unselected steps the value set in the effect will be used. \n\n\"-\" removes the automation.
